alert.note: Alert for Nevada; Placer (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 10:57AM PST until January 01 at 5:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... Truckee River Near Truckee affecting Placer and Nevada Counties. West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. East Fork Carson River Below Markleeville affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. Carson River Near Carson City affecting Carson City, Churchill, Douglas and Lyon independent cities. For the Truckee River...including Truckee, Farad, Reno, Vista, Wadsworth...elevated river levels are forecast. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...elevated river levels are forecast. For the East Fork Carson River...including Markleeville, Gardnerville...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Mainstem Carson River...including Carson City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Truckee River Near Truckee. High flows on the Truckee River will reach Reno by Saturday morning and Wadsworth by Saturday evening. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor flooding from Bear Creek in the Alpine Meadows area to Truckee. Truckee River bike path between the River Ranch at Alpine Meadows Road to Tahoe City flooded up to a foot deep. Minor flooding of basements and yards of some low-lying homes along the river. Deep Creek Campground has limited access due to flooding. Minor flooding begins at Silver Creek Campground. About 2850 cfs. USGS estimates this much flow has about a 1 in 5 chance of being exceeded any year. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM PST Friday the stage was 1.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 4.8 feet late tonight. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by tomorrow morning.
